The source of the claim: The expert's verdict highlights that the claim originated from a Facebook post by Sid Miller, the Texas agriculture commissioner, who is known for regularly posting memes and photos without attribution. This raises doubts about the credibility of the claim.
Lack of attribution: The photo of Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson wearing the T-shirt was shared by Sid Miller without proper attribution. This lack of attribution raises concerns about the authenticity of the claim.
Inconsistencies in the photo: The expert's analysis of the photo revealed alignment problems with the text on the T-shirt and a smudge next to Johnson's arm, suggesting that there may have been additional text or imagery removed. These inconsistencies further cast doubt on the authenticity of the claim.
Previous instances of misinformation: The expert mentions that Sid Miller had previously posted a fake image of Barack Obama, as well as other misleading or unsupported information. This history of sharing false information raises questions about Miller's credibility and adds to the skepticism surrounding the claim.
